TITLE: Initializing Swiper Vue Components DESCRIPTION: Example of using new Swiper Vue.js (v3) components introduced in version 6.2.0. This snippet demonstrates how to set up a basic Swiper instance with slides in a Vue template. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Swiper React Components DESCRIPTION: Example of using Swiper React components introduced in version 6.0.0. This snippet shows how to create a basic Swiper instance with slides and event handlers in a React component. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` import { Swiper, SwiperSlide } from 'swiper/react'; export default () => { return ( console.log(swiper)} onSlideChange={() => console.log('slide change')} > Slide 1 Slide 2 ... ); }; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Swiper JS Carousels with Multiple Slide Sets in HTML DESCRIPTION: This HTML code demonstrates a complete implementation of Swiper.js with three different carousel configurations. It includes a standard carousel with pagination and navigation, a coverflow effect carousel, and a free-mode carousel with custom spacing and slide options. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/TODO.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` Swiper demo
Slide 1
Slide 2
Slide 3
Slide 4
Slide 5
Slide 6
Slide 7
Slide 8
Slide 9
Slide 10
Slide 1
Slide 2
Slide 3
Slide 4
Slide 5
Slide 6
Slide 7

Slide 9
Slide 10

Slide 2
Slide 3
Slide 4

Slide 9
Slide 10
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Swiper Slides with React DESCRIPTION: Example of using the SwiperSlide component with a render function to conditionally render content based on slide state. This feature was introduced in version 6.1.0. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: jsx CODE: ``` {({ isActive }) =>
Current slide is {isActive ? 'active' : 'not active'}
} ... ... ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Swiper Breakpoints Configuration DESCRIPTION: JavaScript configuration example showing how to set up responsive breakpoints in Swiper. Demonstrates setting different slidesPerView and spaceBetween values for different screen sizes. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-14_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` slidesPerView: 5, spaceBetween: 50, breakpoints: { 1024: { slidesPerView: 4, spaceBetween: 40 }, 768: { slidesPerView: 3, spaceBetween: 30 }, 320: { slidesPerView: 1, spaceBetween: 10 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Swiper Configuration in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: Example of setting new Swiper parameters introduced in version 5.3.0, including slidesPerGroupSkip and ratio-based breakpoints. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` const swiper = new Swiper('.swiper-container', { slidesPerGroupSkip: 2, breakpoints: { '50%': { slidesPerView: 2, }, '75%': { slidesPerView: 3, } } }); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Swiper Dependencies DESCRIPTION: Command to install all dependencies for Swiper development. This should be run in the repository's root directory before building the project. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ npm install ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Swiper Development Version DESCRIPTION: Command to build the development version of Swiper. The build output will be available in the dist/ folder. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ npm run build ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building Swiper Production Version DESCRIPTION: Command to build the production version of Swiper. This creates optimized files that are ready for production use in the dist/ folder. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ npm run build:prod ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring CSS Custom Properties for Swiper Theme in CSS DESCRIPTION: Example of using CSS custom properties introduced in version 5.0.0 to set Swiper's color theme. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-14_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` :root { --swiper-theme-color: #007aff; --swiper-navigation-color: #000; --swiper-pagination-color: #000; --swiper-navigation-size: 44px; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Structure for Zoom Functionality DESCRIPTION: Required HTML layout structure for implementing zoom functionality in Swiper slides. The structure requires a swiper-zoom-container div wrapping the image element. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-14_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Git Topic Branch for Contributions DESCRIPTION: Git commands demonstrating how to create a topic branch for contributions based on the master branch. This ensures contributors avoid working directly on the master branch to prevent potential conflicts. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git branch master/my_contribution master ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Git Whitespace Issues DESCRIPTION: Git command to check for unnecessary whitespace before committing changes. This helps maintain clean code without whitespace-related issues. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git diff --check ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Out Git Topic Branch DESCRIPTION: Git command to checkout a newly created topic branch for development work. This switches the working directory to the new branch for contribution. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git checkout master/my_contribution ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Links and Badges Configuration DESCRIPTION: HTML structure for the project's documentation header, including navigation links, contributor badges, and build status indicators. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```

Get Started | Documentation | Demos

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating HTML Sponsor Table in Markdown for Swiper Project DESCRIPTION: This HTML code snippet embedded in Markdown creates a responsive table to display sponsor logos, links to their websites, and brief descriptions. The table is organized in rows with multiple columns, where each cell contains an image, link, and alt text. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/BACKERS.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sponsors Table Layout in HTML DESCRIPTION: HTML table structure for displaying sponsor logos in a grid layout with company links and alt text descriptions. Each cell contains an anchor tag with an image element aligned center. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/BACKERS.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Sponsor Table in HTML DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet creates a table to display sponsor logos and links for the Swiper project. It uses nested table rows and cells to organize the sponsors into a grid layout. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Sponsor Links Table Structure DESCRIPTION: HTML table markup for displaying sponsor logos in a grid layout with linked images. Each cell contains an anchor tag with an image element showing sponsor logos at 160px width. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/BACKERS.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering Sponsor Grid in HTML DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet creates a table-based grid layout to display sponsor logos and links. Each cell contains an image and a hyperlink for a sponsor of the Swiper project. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering HTML Contributors Grid DESCRIPTION: HTML table markup that creates a responsive grid of contributor cards. Each card contains an avatar image, contributor name, and contribution type indicator linked to their GitHub profile and commits. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CODE_CONTRIBUTORS.md#2025-04-14_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
Jakob Stenqvist
💻 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Rendering HTML Contributors Table DESCRIPTION: HTML table structure displaying contributor information including profile images, usernames, links and contribution types. Each contributor is shown in a cell with their GitHub avatar, profile link and contribution emoji indicator. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/CODE_CONTRIBUTORS.md#2025-04-14_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
naedx
💻
nealnote
💻 [...additional contributor cells...] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sponsor Tier Information in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Markdown formatted sections describing available sponsor tiers with links to contribution pages on OpenCollective. SOURCE: https://github.com/nolimits4web/swiper/blob/master/BACKERS.md#2025-04-14_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: Markdown CODE: ``` ### \$500 Platinum Sponsor [Currently vacant. It could be you!](https://opencollective.com/swiper/contribute/platinum-sponsor-24468/checkout) --- ### \$250 Gold Sponsor [Currently vacant. It could be you!](https://opencollective.com/swiper/contribute/gold-sponsor-24466/checkout) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Displaying Silver Sponsors in Markdown DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to list silver sponsors using HTML comments and markdown formatting. It includes a bulleted list of sponsor names and websites, wrapped in HTML comments for easy updating.
